title: There’s something truly magical about Sri Lanka” - Julie Chung in farewell message
byline: Outgoing United States Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Julie Chung, has expressed her gratitude to everyone who helped boost US–Sri Lanka ties during her nearly four-year tenure in the country and also the Sri Lankan people who she praised for their resilience and determination.

title: Jinthupitiya Shooting: Victim succumbs to injuries
byline: Police have confirmed that the individual who was critically injured in a shooting incident last night (16) in the Jinthupitiya area in Colombo, has succumbed to his injuries after being admitted to the National Hospital of Colombo.

title: Indian Army constructs third Bailey bridge in Sri Lanka, restoring connectivity
byline: The Indian Army has successfully constructed a third Bailey bridge on Sri Lanka’s B-492 Highway, linking Kandy and Nuwara Eliya in the Central Province, restoring a critical lifeline that was severed for over a month following Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Son arrested for assaulting father to death in Madawachchiya
byline: A 67-year-old father of two was killed following an assault at a residence in the Kadawatgama area of Madawachchiya yesterday (16).

title: Eric Meyer tipped to be appointed next US Ambassador to Sri Lanka
byline: Eric Meyer is set to be appointed as the next United States Ambassador to Sri Lanka, according to reports indicating that U.S. President Donald Trump has nominated him for the diplomatic post.

title: Mainly dry weather expected over most parts of the country
byline: The Meteorology Department states that mainly dry weather will prevail over most parts of the island.

title: Trump appoints Tony Blair, Marco Rubio and more to Gaza ‘board of peace’
byline: The White House has announced names of the so-called “Board of Peace” that will, under President Donald Trump’s plan, supervise the temporary governance of Gaza.

title: Trump threatens new tariffs on countries opposed to Greenland takeover
byline: US President Donald Trump has threatened to place tariffs on nations that do not go along with his ambitions to annex Greenland.

title: MP Asoka Ranwala’s wife hospitalized after vehicle involved in accident
byline: Former Speaker and National People’s Power (NPP) Member of Parliament Asoka Ranwala’s wife has been hospitalized following a car accident, Biyagama Police said.

title: ChatGPT to carry adverts for some users
byline: Adverts will soon appear at the top of the AI tool ChatGPT for some users, the company OpenAI has announced.

title: Three associates of ‘Dubai Ishara’ arrested with heroin in Gampola
byline: Three suspects involved in the sale of narcotics linked to “Dubai Ishara”—a major drug trafficker operating a local drug network from Dubai—were arrested by the Gampola Police this morning (17).

title: Musk’s Starlink faces high-profile security test in Iran crackdown
byline: Iran’s crackdown on dissidents is shaping up as one of the toughest security tests yet for Elon Musk’s Starlink, which has served as a lifeline against state-imposed internet blackouts since its deployment during the war in Ukraine.

title: Several train services including night mail trains to resume
byline: The Railway Department of Sri Lanka has taken steps to resume several train services, including the night mail trains from Colombo Fort to Trincomalee and Batticaloa, which were suspended due to Cyclone “Ditwah”.

title: Nuwara Eliya records lowest temperature at 8°C today
byline: The lowest temperature in Sri Lanka today (17) was recorded at the Nuwara Eliya Meteorological Station at 8.0 degrees Celsius, according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Sri Lanka welcomes over 130,000 tourists in first 15 days of 2026
byline: The Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) has reported that a total of 131,898 tourists visited the country during the first 15 days of 2026.

title: Shooting in South African township leaves 7 dead
byline: Gunmen killed seven people in a township outside the South African city of Cape Town early on Saturday in an incident believed to be extortion-related, police said.

title: When does the Nasa Moon mission launch and who are the Artemis II crew?
byline: The first crewed Moon mission in more than 50 years could be launched by Nasa as soon as the first week of February.

title: ‘Are you dead?’ Chinese app for single living goes viral
byline: An app called “Are you dead” targeted at people living alone has gone viral in China, with surging downloads and widespread commentary on social media, prompting the company to introduce a subscription fee and change its name for a global audience.

title: Special announcement on 2025 A/L Home Economics practical exam
byline: The Department of Examinations of Sri Lanka, has issued a special announcement regarding the practical examination for the subject of Home Economics for the G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) Examination (2025).

title: Minister Nalinda Jayatissa calls on Chief Prelates of Malwathu and Asgiri Chapters
byline: Minister of Health and Mass Media Dr Nalinda Jayatissa, and Deputy Minister of Health Dr Hansaka Wijemuni have paid a visit to the Chief Prelates of the Malwathu and Asgiri Chapters and received their blessings.

title: Education reform process will not be reversed - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr Harini Amarasuriya has reaffirmed that the ongoing education reform process will proceed without hindrance, emphasizing that the government has not taken a single step back from implementing transformative changes in the education sector.

title: Demerit points system for traffic offences to be implemented from July-end
byline: The demerit points system for drivers who violate traffic laws is scheduled to be implemented from the end of July, according to Deputy Inspector General (DIG) of Police in charge of Traffic Control and Road Safety, W. P. J. Senadheera.

title: Indonesian ATR aircraft with 11 on board goes missing, debris seen on mountain
byline: An Indonesian ATR 42-500 aircraft has gone missing near Makassar, with videos circulating on social media appearing to show debris on a mountain close to the area where contact with the plane was lost, according to flight-tracking data and local media reports.

title: Iran’s leader Khamenei blames Trump for inciting deadly protests
byline: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on Saturday blamed President Donald Trump for weeks of protests after rights groups said a violent crackdown by security forces had claimed thousands of lives.

title: Trump says 8 European countries will be charged 10% tariff for opposing US control of Greenland
byline: President Donald Trump said Saturday that he would charge a 10% import tax starting in February on goods from eight European countries because of opposition to U.S. control of Greenland.

title: Rare purple star sapphire, claimed to be biggest of its kind, unveiled in Sri Lanka
byline: A Purple Star Sapphire weighing 3,563 carats which is claimed to be the world’s biggest of its kind was unveiled on Saturday in the Sri Lankan capital by the owners, who are ready to sell the precious stone which is estimated to be worth at least $300 million.
